results.title: r/Spanish on Reddit: How do you talk to a cat or dog in Spanish?
results.description: Answer or ask questions, share information, stories, and more on themes related to the 2nd most spoken language in the world by native speakers. ... Most people talk to their pets. In English some of the most common examples of this is asking a dog "who''s a good boy/girl?"

meta_url.path: ‚Ä∫ r/spanish  ‚Ä∫ how do you talk to a cat or dog in spanish?

qa.question: Most people talk to their pets. In English some of the most common examples of this is asking a dog "who''s a good boy/girl?" Or saying "biiiiig stretch" when a cat stretches or asking "is that nice?" When giving a good belly rub or head scritches. Even when just entering a room it's common to say something like "hi, pumpkin/honey/sweetie/____(insert whatever term of endearment or nickname you call your pet here)". What some common ways to talk to pets Spanish? What are some common terms of endearment are there for pets in Spanish? My Spaniard friends has a kitten but only talks to it in Spanish. I would like to be able to talk to the cat too when I visit her house. Googling how to talk to pets in Spanish just teaches you how to say you have a pet, good boy/girl, and a list of common dog commands but not how to actually have a conversation with them.

answer.text: With my dog it's a mix between baby talk and calling him usted üßê

results.title: Can't Find Anyone To Speak Spanish To? Try Talking to Your Pet
results.description: If you are looking for someone to talk in Spanish with, how about talking directly to your pet? extra_snippets: If you are looking for someone to talk in Spanish with, how about talking directly to your pet? Learning Spanish can be easy with ongoing practice ‚Äî even with your pet dog or cat. There are benefits of talking to an animal over a human. You will not get any nasty corrections, and you will get a chance to practice talking without any interruptions.

Learning Spanish can be easy with ongoing practice ‚Äî even with your pet dog or cat. There are benefits of talking to an animal over a human. You will not get any nasty corrections, and you will get a chance to practice talking without any interruptions. Plus, even when you make a mistake, your pet will still be there unconditionally throughout your Spanish-language learning journey.

Remember that most of the time the genders given below for animals remain the same, whether the particular animal is male or female. ... Fish: el pez. A tropical fish is un pez tropical ... Hamster: el h√°mster (usually pronounced as j√°mster; plural can include either versions h√°msters or h√°msteres) ... After discovering what to call your pet in Spanish, you can progress to learning the animal sounds your pets might make, just in case they do make some noises or otherwise talk back to you while you are speaking to them in Spanish.

Note that a pet in Spanish can be referred to as una mascota, the same word used for a mascot, such as an animal symbolizing a team. The term un animal dom√©stico and the adjective dom√©stico can also be used to mean "pet" as an adjective, as in un perro dom√©stico, a pet dog.

results.title: Can Cats Speak to Us? | Inside Adams
results.description: Many cat owners will tell you they can interpret the meaning of their pet‚Äôs sounds, but are these actual words that can be translated and compared amongst different cats? Do cats have an actual language?
extra_snippets: Grimaldi began his essay by defending the merits of cats; however, he took his argument a step further by asserting that cats have an actual language that can be understood by humans. This included both vocalized words and physical signs. As an example, he described various meanings of tail movements.

A tail straight up in the air indicates pride and satisfaction; while a tail waving side to side shows dislike. A tail curled under the body means fear; while a tail pointed towards the fire signifies rain is on the way (Clark, 120-121). (All but one of these examples remains a commonly held belief about cat tail signals‚Ä¶ I‚Äôll let you guess which one is not).

His precision and detail-oriented approach to cat language can be seen in this quote: In the word part of the language of the Cat there are, probably, not more than six hundred fundamental words, all others being derivatives. Consonants are daintily used, while a wide berth is given to explosives and the liquid letters ‚ÄúL‚Äù and ‚ÄúR‚Äù enter into the great majority of sounds.

Consonants are daintily used, while a wide berth is given to explosives and the liquid letters ‚ÄúL‚Äù and ‚ÄúR‚Äù enter into the great majority of sounds. The sounds of the labials are not frequently heard, but the vowels, A, E, I, O, and U, go far toward making up the entire complement of words in the language of the Cat.

results.title: Is my cat speaking English? (not as stupid of a question as it sounds) - animalbehavior meow meowing | Ask MetaFilter
results.description: Call it English, call it cat language, call it what you want, but you three have all been trained to react to some sort of language or attempt at communication. Your cat can consistently make different but certain sounds for each of you. My cats have all understood their names.
extra_snippets: My cat Rembrandt's first human spoke Spanish as her primary language, and even after four years with me he still responds really well if he hears Spanish, even my minimal "donde esta mi gatito grande?" attempts at it. He now also responds to English, but at first he had a really hard time because the sounds I was making were unfamiliar to him. I would love to hear audio of your kitty talking, but short version - yeah, he could be doing that. Also Tumnis is a charming name for a cat. posted by bile and syntax at 8:54 PM on October 24, 2017 [2 favorites]

Call it English, call it cat language, call it what you want, but you three have all been trained to react to some sort of language or attempt at communication. Your cat can consistently make different but certain sounds for each of you. My cats have all understood their names.

It's possible that your Tumnus has noticed certain intonations work more quickly or better than others; if you respond more quickly, or more excitedly, when you think the cat is 'saying' your names, the cat will be more likely to use that intonation each time he wants your attention. I don't think he's 'speaking English' but I do think that perhaps you, your husband, and Tumnus are building a language together. posted by halation at 3:25 PM on October 24, 2017 [40 favorites]

I never thought of is as a cat speaking English. I see it as an attempt to communicate. I think it's not surprising at all that animals that are intelligent and motivated enough, mimic our words and gestures, as do some dogs, parrots and apes. What surprises me are people who think it can't be possible. I had a cat once who used one word, or close to it, quite emphatically.

answer.text: When my father died, I took over care of his dog. Later that night, I went to his house with his dog to get some of her things. We both were freaking out and she was running from room to room looking for him and when she jumped on his bed, I leaned over her, and said to her hind end, ‚ÄúDaddy is dead. He‚Äôs not coming back. You‚Äôre going to be with me now and you‚Äôre going to be OK.‚Äù And her demeanor changed immediately after that. She wasn‚Äôt running around still looking for him but casually strolling around sniffing around, as in here was where my bowl was, here was where Daddy sat, I can still smell him here. Another time right before a 4H exhibition, I said to her, ‚ÄúAs long as you‚Äôre with me, you‚Äôll be OK.‚Äù And she was remarkably well-behaved since before whenever she was out in public, she was making some scene.

results.title: How to Decode What Your Cat Is Trying to Say
results.description: Cats speak by using complex combinations of body language, vocalization, and scent cues. Learn how to recognize cat language basics, and figure out the most common combinations, to understand what your cat is saying to you and to the other pets in your family.
extra_snippets: Cats have been regarded for centuries as mysterious, solitary, unpredictable creatures perhaps because humans have difficulty understanding what they're saying. While people rely primarily on speech to communicate, cats predominately communicate in a silent language. Cats speak by using complex combinations of body language, vocalization, and scent cues.

Cats speak by using complex combinations of body language, vocalization, and scent cues. Generally speaking, the more a cat‚Äôs ears swivel sideways and backward, the greater the cat‚Äôs arousal or distress. Cats communicate with their eyelids‚Äîhow open or closed they are‚Äîas well as with the dilation of the pupil (black portion of the eye). A sudden dilation (enlarging) of the pupil results from sudden arousal which could be due to fear, interest, or any other strong emotion.

results.title: Talking to Animals in Spanish - Spanish Playground
results.description: Talking to animals in Spanish helps kids learn language. Pets create situations for parents to speak Spanish as kids listen. Pets can listen to kids, too.

meta_url.path: ‚Ä∫ home  ‚Ä∫ talking to animals in spanish

extra_snippets: Pets can serve as a conversation partner so we can speak more Spanish around our kids. For example, talking to animals in Spanish is an easy way to model greetings. You can also comment on anything you are doing or things you see by addressing the dog or cat:

In addition, talking to animals in Spanish as you normally would in English, with all the normal dog or cat phrases, lets kids hear repeated language in specific situations. Finally, pets can provide a receptive, non-judgmental audience for kids to read or sing to. Pets can serve as a conversation partner so we can speak more Spanish around our kids.

How you help create these situations will depend on your child and your pet, but do keep your animals in mind as language learning allies. Little ones may ‚Äúteach‚Äù the dog his body parts in Spanish or sing new song. Older kids may read aloud to the cat. However, it works out in your household, the odds are that both kids and animals will benefit.

You can also comment on anything you are doing or things you see by addressing the dog or cat: Hola, ya regresamos. Voy a cerrar la puerta. Buen chico. Ahora Olivia va a hacer su tarea. Yo tengo que recoger un poco. ¬øNos vas a acompa√±ar? (On a walk). ¬øTe gusta pasear, verdad? ¬øVes esas flores bonitas? Me encantan. Of course, you can and should describe what you are doing to your child. However, there are times when kids are tired, or prefer not to be directly engaged for any number of reasons.

results.title: The intelligence of dogs and cats - Animals Matter
results.description: During a class I was teaching in San Antonio, participants asked about the intelligence of dogs. When I asked how many words they thought a dog could understand, one man said seven, another said 70‚Ä¶
extra_snippets: Of course, what dog owner amongst us hasn‚Äôt had to spell t-r-e-a-t or w-a-l-k? Our dogs do understand language and much better than most of us may think. On average, a dog can learn about 100 human words in the same language of their owner. In other words, if you speak English, your dog learns English. If you speak Spanish, your dog learns Spanish. If you speak Chinese, then your dog‚Ä¶well you get the point. One dog, thanks to five hours of training a day, has learned over 1,000 words, which they say is equivalent to a three year old human child‚Äôs language skills.

If you speak Spanish, your dog learns Spanish. If you speak Chinese, then your dog‚Ä¶well you get the point. One dog, thanks to five hours of training a day, has learned over 1,000 words, which they say is equivalent to a three year old human child‚Äôs language skills. Basically, dogs learn if we teach them, which is why teaching them is hugely important to their happiness and development. Training makes dogs smarter.

Training makes dogs smarter. I can‚Äôt guarantee you will train a dog into learning 1,000 words, but 100 words is clearly in sight. What about cats? When I ask the same group of people to guess how many words a cat can understand, they say zero. These people either don‚Äôt have cats or don‚Äôt interact much with their cats because zero is just plain wrong.

And let‚Äôs face it, few among us even tries to train our cats, so how do we know what they are capable of? It‚Äôs a combination of training our pets and listening to what they are trying to say to us that may help us best connect. They are certainly trying to understand our language; we could benefit from listening to their ‚Äúlanguage‚Äù too.

items.answer: You should never punish a cat, as cats are not by nature as trusting as dogs. Yelling, shaking, or squirting a bottle at a cat can really do some disrepair to your ability to bond with them.

items.question: What does it mean when a cat rubs against your leg or presses its head on yours?
items.answer: This behavior has a name and it's called "bunting". It is a sign of affection and possession on the part of the cat. In part she is also spreading scent from the glands on her head, onto you as a means of marking you as hers. Take it as a compliment!

items.question:
How long does it take when teaching your cat to meow?
EDITS: How long does it take to teach a cat to meow?
items.answer: That depends on the breed and how clever the cat is. Some breeds are more vocal than others, such as the Siamese cat, and so it's easier to get her to meow initially, and mark the behavior so she does it again. Other breeds such as the Persian are more silent and vocalization does not come naturally. In addition, some cats are clever and will cotton on to what you want in as short as a few minutes, whilst others take weeks, months, or may never "Get it".

The only way he knows how to be is through meowing and his body language. Therefore, you will need to learn the cat language even before you train him to be speaking English. Below, we are going to look at some of the most common cat communication cues you may look out for.

To have your cat speaking English, you should start by understanding his means of communication. This way, you will be able to always understand what he needs. extra_snippets: Learn to communicate better with your kitty by following the instructions in this article. ... Training your cat to talk is easier than you might think. Feline friends are known for being aloof to their human counterparts, but did you know they are highly social creatures with their own style of verbal communication?

I tell people my cat talks to me and they act like I am crazy. Clearly, they do not have cats. :-) I have had many cats and they all had their own way of speaking. I loved listening to them talking to each other. I have one cat and one Pomeranian and they will talk to each other.

:-) I have had many cats and they all had their own way of speaking. I loved listening to them talking to each other. I have one cat and one Pomeranian and they will talk to each other. My Pom makes little squeaky noises and my cat replies back with different tones of meow or mer sounds.

Cats tend to be group-oriented, which is to say that they will absorb the family personality and will interact with their own group of feline friends, as well as with the household of the pet owner. It is not unusual during my early morning walks to see several cats congregated on someone's lawn or in the alley. Because most of the people in my neighborhood are daytime workers, pets are usually let out to potty between the hours of 6 a.m. and 8 a.m.
